definition: to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
oath/pledge/union/to ally/league, a subdivision corresponding to prefecture in Inner Mongolia

sentences.english: Allying with an opponent during a match is unusual and is not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 比賽中與對手結盟是不被允許的異常行爲。

sentences.english: Abjection 3 people decide to form an alliance, revenge for each other.
sentences.chinese: 落魄的三人決定結盟，替彼此報仇。

sentences.english: A policy of neutrality or nonalignment in international affairs.
sentences.chinese: 國際事務中保持中立或不結盟的政策。

sentences.english: Union of Transylvania with Romania was ratified in 1920.
sentences.chinese: 1920年，特蘭西瓦尼亞與羅馬尼亞的結盟被批准。

sentences.english: Making renju friend does NOT mean making political alliance against someone else.
sentences.chinese: 結交五子棋朋友並不意味着是和誰結盟。

sentences.english: The nations of the Non-Aligned Movement were invited as well.
sentences.chinese: 不結盟運動的國家也受到邀請。

sentences.english: Britain was allied with the United States many times in history.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上英國曾多次與美國結盟。

sentences.english: The new treaty embodies the aspirations of most nonaligned countries.
sentences.chinese: 新條約體現了大多數不結盟國家的願望。

sentences.english: It talked mainly from history and the period of the Sino-Soviet alliance to analyze.
sentences.chinese: 主要從歷史和中蘇結盟時期兩個時段加以解析。

sentences.english: Nonalignment is the part and parcel of that country's foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 不結盟是那個國家外交政策的重要內容。

sentences.english: They aligned themselves with one side, or got ground between millstones.
sentences.chinese: 他們必須與一方結盟，或在夾縫中求生。

sentences.english: However, the Chechens who were allied to the Afghan Taliban had been more polite.
sentences.chinese: 然而，與阿富汗塔利班人結盟的車臣人則禮貌得多。

sentences.english: Our country pursues a policy of nonalignment.
Thomas Jefferson warned of entangling alliances.
The paper was divided into three parts to expatiate on and analyse the Chinese non-alignment foreign strategy.
sentences.chinese: 本文分三部分對中國不結盟外交戰略進行闡述和分析。

definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
dealer/trader/person engaged in some industry or trade
to consult with/to talk things over/agreement
